Question_1.Context: The study focuses on the synthesis of carbon nanoparticles using mandarin juice and their interaction with graphene. Optical microscopy was used to analyze the morphology of nano-micro droplets. What technique was employed to determine the molecular structure of organic and inorganic compounds present inside nanomaterials?
Question_1.Question: What technique was used to observe the molecular structure of organic and inorganic compounds present inside nanomaterials?
Question_1.Source: NMR spectroscopy reveals the molecular structure of organic and inorganic compounds present inside nanomaterials. By analyzing the chemical shifts, coupling constants, and relaxation periods of atomic nuclei, we may determine the connectivity, spatial organization, and conformational properties of molecules.

Question_2.Context: The study discusses the synthesis of carbon nanoparticles from mandarin juice and their unique features. UV-vis-nir spectroscopy was used to investigate the optical characteristics of the synthesized materials. What was the purpose of using UV-vis-nir spectroscopy in the study?
Question_2.Question: What was the purpose of using UV-vis-nir spectroscopy in the study?
Question_2.A: To analyze the overall morphology of nano-micro droplets
Question_2.B: To determine the molecular structure of organic compounds
Question_2.C: To investigate the optical characteristics of the synthesized materials
Question_2.D: To study the surface morphology of nano-micro droplets
Question_2.Source: UV-vis-nir spectroscopy is used to investigate the optical characteristics of the synthesized materials. We are able to identify the UV, visible, and near-infrared absorption and transmission properties of nano-micro droplets using UV-vis-nir spectroscopy.

Question_3.Context: The research involved the synthesis of carbon nanoparticles and their interaction with graphene. FESEM was used to examine the nano-micro droplet structures in detail. What information can be obtained by using FESEM?
Question_3.Question: What information can be obtained by using FESEM?
Question_3.Source: FESEM is used to examine the nano-micro droplet structures in more detail. We are able to investigate the surface morphology, particle configurations, and probable nanoparticle aggregation within the droplets using this technique, which produces high-resolution images.

Question_4.Context: The study explored the synthesis of carbon nanoparticles and their properties. NMR spectroscopy was used to observe the NMR spectra. What does NMR spectroscopy provide detailed information about?
Question_4.Question: What does NMR spectroscopy provide detailed information about?
Question_4.Source: NMR spectroscopy provides detailed information about the presence of nearby atoms, groups of atoms, or functional groups attached to an atom. It reveals information about chemical shifts, coupling constants, and relaxation periods of atomic nuclei.

Question_5.Context: The research involved the synthesis of carbon nanoparticles and their interaction with graphene. EDX analysis was used to identify the chemical components of nanomaterials. What does EDX analysis determine?
Question_5.Question: What does EDX analysis determine?
Question_5.Source: EDX analysis is used to identify the chemical components of nanomaterials. The elemental makeup of the nanomaterial is determined by detecting and studying the characteristic X-rays produced when the sample is hit with an electron beam.

Question_6.Context: The study focused on the synthesis of carbon nanoparticles and their properties. UV-vis-nir spectroscopy was used to observe UV-visible spectra. What was the purpose of extrapolating the curve in UV-vis-nir spectroscopy?
Question_6.Question: What was the purpose of extrapolating the curve in UV-vis-nir spectroscopy?
Question_6.A: To determine the molecular weight of the nanoparticles
Question_6.B: To calculate the energy band gap of the materials
Question_6.C: To analyze the chemical composition of nanomaterials
Question_6.D: To study the surface morphology of nanoparticles
Question_6.Source: The energy band gap was observed by extrapolating the curve with the help of a tangent line, and the band gaps of the Pure LC, Carbon nanocluster, and carbon nanocluster doped LC system were calculated from the UV-vis-nir spectroscopy data.

Question_7.Context: The research involved the synthesis of carbon nanoparticles and their interaction with graphene. NMR spectroscopy was used to observe the NMR spectra. What information can be determined by analyzing the chemical shifts in NMR spectroscopy?
Question_7.Question: What information can be determined by analyzing the chemical shifts in NMR spectroscopy?
Question_7.C: Connectivity and spatial organization of molecules
Question_7.D: Presence of nearby atoms and functional groups
Question_7.Source: By analyzing the chemical shifts in NMR spectroscopy, one can determine the connectivity, spatial organization, and conformational properties of molecules. The study reveals information about nearby atoms, groups of atoms, or functional groups attached to an atom.

Question_8.Context: The study discussed the synthesis of carbon nanoparticles and their properties. EDX analysis was used to identify the chemical components of nanomaterials. What does the EDX spectrum confirm the existence of in the LC sample?
Question_8.Question: What does the EDX spectrum confirm the existence of in the LC sample?
Question_8.Source: The existence of carbon atoms in the LC sample is confirmed by the EDX spectrum. The elemental weight percentages of C (60.93 wt%) in the 6CHBT LC molecule are shown in the EDX spectrum.

Question_9.Context: The research focused on the synthesis of carbon nanoparticles and their interaction with graphene. NMR spectroscopy was used to observe the NMR spectra. What information can be obtained by studying the peaks in the NMR spectra?
Question_9.Question: What information can be obtained by studying the peaks in the NMR spectra?
Question_9.C: Presence of nearby atoms and functional groups
Question_9.Source: The peaks in the NMR spectra provide information about nearby atoms, groups of atoms, or functional groups attached to an atom. NMR spectroscopy reveals the molecular structure of organic and inorganic compounds present inside nanomaterials.

Question_10.Context: The study discussed the synthesis of carbon nanoparticles and their properties. FESEM was used to examine the nano-micro droplet structures in detail. What can be observed by using FESEM?
Question_10.Question: What can be observed by using FESEM?
Question_10.Source: FESEM is used to examine the nano-micro droplet structures in more detail. We are able to investigate the surface morphology, particle configurations, and probable nanoparticle aggregation within the droplets using this technique, which produces high-resolution images.
